page.title: 04The European Grand Prix 1985
page.content:
The{European Grand Prix}for motor cars was held at Brands Hatch on 6th October 1985. It was moved there after insoluble problems at the original venue.
The organisation at Brands Hatch is extremely efficient and the{whole race {was organised in less than ninety {days.} This is the second time in recent years that Brands Hatch has stepped in to rescue the European Grand Prix.
The race was a memorable one, in which the British driver,{Nigel Mansell,}had his first ever Grand Prix victory in over fifty starts. {Alain Prost,}by finishing fourth, ahead of{Michele {Alboretto,}clinched the{World Driver's {championship,}the first time a French- man had ever won the championship.
